thread.title: Tiverton's Brexit fears discussed with Devon for Europe street stall

author: Lewis Clarke
title: Tiverton's Brexit fears discussed with Devon for Europe street stall
text:
Tiverton's Brexit fears discussed with Devon for Europe street stall Group headed to town's pannier market on Saturday as part of campaign to stay in the EU Share The Devon for Europe Street Stall in Tiverton Share Get Daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
People in Tiverton feeling anxious about the Brexit impact were able to discuss their concerns with Devon for Europe this weekend. 
A team of five activists from Devon for Europe ran a street stall outside the Pannier Market on Saturday January 20. Despite grim weather, they found more than 50 people keen to talk about Brexit, 36 of whom signed up to receive more information on the campaign to stay in the EU. 
The group say there were some common themes in the conversations. A spokesperson for the group said: “Many felt they had bee mislead over the consequences of Brexit, particularly with regard to the funding of the NHS, and that they had not had enough facts on which to base their vote. Read More Anne Marie Morris MP apologises again for n r in the woodpile' comment - but says there is an issue with racism in rural areas 
“Many expressed dismay at how terrible they felt Brexit would be and the negative impact it would have on future generations. There was frustration with MPs and a sense that many were putting party before country and going ahead with Brexit despite the damage it will do. 
“Nearly everyone was in favour of the people having a final say on the terms of any deal with an option to remain being an essential feature of that vote.” 
Devon for Europe were encouraged by the willingness to engage, the gratitude expressed at their presence and the appetite for more information. Like us on Facebook
